description.narrative: The Research for Development initiative aims to provide a leading international example of how the non-government organisation and university sectors can collaborate on development research to better inform policy and practice. Phase One was development and embedding of a rigorous research ethics process within the Australian development NGO sector and the development of guiding principles for ethical research conducted by universities in developing countries. Phase Two aims to bridge the gap between academics and practitioners and to develop sector standards and guidance. Phase Three aims to utilise the Network to strengthen evidence-based development policy, innovation and practice across the Australian development sector. The total value of this initiative is $1.7 million over 6 years, starting 2011-12.
